title: Improve error message when view construction fails

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
Attempting to create a view that erroneously links packages with the same name into the same prefix results in a somewhat cryptic error message: `Error: the transactional move of ".../views/default" failed.` A different error message, which tells the end user directly about the conflict, or what might be done to correct the view definition, would be an improvement.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Create an environment "env" with a view that would link two packages with the same name into the same prefix. Say, package "foo" built for two different targets "A" and "B", and the following view description
```yaml
view:
  default:
    root: views/default
    select: [foo]
    projections:
      all: '{name}'
```
```console
$ spack concretize
```

### Error Message

```console
Error: the transactional move of ".../var/spack/environments/env/views/default" failed.
```

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.15.4-687-81bb372d7
* **Python:** 3.8.2
* **Platform:** linux-rhel7-cascadelake
